column1: 1.How many choices are possible when using a single if-else statement?
2.How many "else" statements can you pair with a single "if" statement
3.How many "else if" links can you have in an "if else if" ladder?
4.Which of these is used to add a third or fourth etc outcome to a scenario?
5.Which of the following loops will execute the body of loop even when condition controlling the loop is initially false?
6.What is the data type that can be used with case statement in switch control structure?
7.Which of the following for loops will be an infinite loop?
8.Which of these jump statements can skip processing remainder of code in its body for a particular iteration?

column2: A.Break stops the execution of entire program
column3: B.Break halts the execution and forces the control out of the loop
column4: C.Break forces the control out of the loop and starts the execution of next iteration
column5: D.Break halts the execution of the loop for certain time frame
column6: B.Break halts the execution and forces the control out of the loop

column2: A.do statement executes the code of a loop at least once
column3: B.do statement does not get execute if condition is not matched in the first iteration
column4: C.do statement checks the condition at the beginning of the loop
column5: D.do statement executes the code more than once always
column6: A.do statement executes the code of a loop at least once
